alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Cattaraugus (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 10:46PM EST until February 02 at 11:15PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Cattaraugus County in western New York... Southern Allegany County in western New York... * Until 1115 PM EST. * At 1045 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Hornell to near St. Bonaventure, moving southeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 86 near exit 29, and between exits 32 and 33. Locations impacted include... Olean, Wellsville, Alfred, Whitesville, Weston Mills, St. Bonaventure, Friendship, Scio, Bolivar and Andover. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
